dialogues.text: (Into her lapel) That's it!  Move, move, move!

dialogues.speaker: TERRANCE AND PHILLIP
dialogues.text: A battalion of Army guys appear, seize Terrance and Phill and arrest everyone in their group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip, you are under arrest for working in America without the proper documents! WE GOT YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, what the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip, we've been tricked and ambushed by The Conan O'Brian Show!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little scrotum sucker willfully deceived us! (Pointing to Conan) You are a bad man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you call yourself a Canadian! (To Phillip) I told you we should of done Leno!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan O'Brian turns away, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to them, Mr. O'Brian. They're master manipulators. You did a good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loved our movie, Conan!  We watched it together.  You... You laughed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan grabs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan grabs a gun and blows his head off, dousing Brooke Shields with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGAHGAHGGH!!!! Mondays at eight AAAGHGH!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip laugh merrily. Kyle's mother cradles Conan's lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what your filth has caused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: US?! This is your mess, outraged mother!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are sitting on the couch in absolute shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, our moms arrested Terrance and Phillip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our moms suck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could mean... No more Terrance and Phillip - EVER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of foreigners with their silly foreign outfits sit a their stupid microphones with their ridiculous translatio headsets -- in the general assembly hall.  The Canadian Ambassador stands before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As The Canadian Ambassador, I hereby condemn the actions taken by America in apprehending Terrance and Phillip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MURMUR goes through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We demand their release IMMEDIATELY!! As you can see from this graph, the entire economy of Canada relies on Terrance and Phillip! Without them we are doomed to recession!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United Nations head bangs his gavel. Now Kyle's mother stands up. She is with a group of mothe all wearing M.A.C T-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Kyle's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As president and founder of M.A.C., I would like to state-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, M.A.C.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mothers Against Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to state that Canada must learn to stop infiltrating our country with its graphic art!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers from the Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I checked America was a free country!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's mother pulls Kenny's mother up by the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman's child was KILLED by your country's humor! Look how upset she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny's mom looks fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will continue to sell Terrance and Phillip videos to anyone retarded enough to buy it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you leave me no choice... I call for an EMBARGO on ALL Canadian Imports!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More cheers from the Americans. The Canadians look worrie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are in the check out line at Bob's supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you mean I can't get Cheesy Poofs?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, kid. Cheesy Poofs are a Canadian export. We can't carry them any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell made up that law?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this!! Have you ever HAD Cheesy Poofs? They're a taste sensation with a delightful cheddar crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do. I can still sell you Cheese-o's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK Cheese-os and FUCK you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartman storms out. The boys follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys walk into Cartman's house. Cartman slams the doo behind him. The boys all walk toward the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys... We have to THINK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Cheesy Poofs, dumbass! This whole thing has gone too far!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really think you need Cheesy- Poofs, tubby-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the boys come to an abrupt halt when they reach the living room and see that all four mothers are waiting for them, silently. Everyone just sits there for a second. The lighting on Ky mother's face looks almost evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, we have to have a difficult discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already know what you did. We saw it on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how come you arrested Terrance and Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanly, you're too young to understand what's good for you. That's why we mothers have taken charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they fucking didn't do anything wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  And what rim job expert went and outlawed Cheesy Poofs!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mothers all gasp in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that word, young man!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he said rim job.  It's when someone licks your ass for-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To his mother) Lick someone's ass?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Terrance and Phillip movie has obviously done irreparable damage to their brains.  We have to put them in rehab right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys need help.  There are rehab centers that specialize in treating people with chronic addictions to bad language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's mother thinks for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well no, I guess not...  But we will establish the first of its kind right here in South Park.  All the children in town will have to attend and receive treatment from the school counselor Mr. Mackey!  Ooh I just love when I get these sorts of ideas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  So you can fuck up our life some more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric!  Don't talk to Ms. Brovlofski that way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But mom!  I'm not fucking addicted to fucking bad language!  I don't have a fucking problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny walks through the black void of hell. A trippy, sin shaft of light seems to follow him wherever he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mphrmo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer... No nothing... Kenny continues on, flames shoot up randomly from the gro scaring the shit out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MPHR!! MMLY MMT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Kenny hears a CLAWING NOISE. It gets louder and louder. Kenny starts to run faster and faster. Now the clawing is RIGHT BEHIND HIM! Kenny spins around. He is fa to face with SATAN! Satan looks down at Kenny and shoots flames out his nose. Kenny's eyes bulge open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MMMMMPHPHPHPHP!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallen one... We have such sights to show you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny shakes. Satan turns to a whispy form and flashes ac the room like a serpent, in a millisecond he is right up Kenny's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Satan. I am your God, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MPH RM!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny tries to run away, but Satan again changes form, fl across the room and cuts Kenny off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. I will show you what delightful pain awaits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two black DEMONS grab Kenny by the arms and start to lead away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MMMMMPHPHP!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, SADDAM HUSSEIN show up next to Satan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a new recruit, huh? Welcome to hell, kid! Relax! Take a load off!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember... Saddam Hussein, don't you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny's eyes grow wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MMMPPH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of the small Betty Fordesque building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are sitting in chairs in a circle.  There are an drug signs on the walls: "Crack is Whack"; "Get High on Pottery"; and, "I Go From Zero to Bitch in .9 Seconds." MACKEY, the wiry school counselor, leads the group.  Ther a pottery wheel and lots of craft tables behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mkay, it's come to my attention, that you boys have a potty-mouth problem, mkay. Now the sooner you recognize your problem, mkay, the sooner we can get you back to your third grade homeroom where you belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're just words, Mr. Mackey. Our parents are over-reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Wendy's here, and she doesn't even like Terrance and Phillip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy looks bored. Stan tries to smile at her, but she doesn't even acknowledge him. Meanwhile, Cartman is violently shaking in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh... You guys, seriously... I'm having Cheesy Poof withdrawal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mkay, kids from all over the State have been brought here, because you all share the same problem. Uh, young man... Let's start with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at Gregory. The little British bastard from the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Gregory... And I have a potty mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy looks at Gregory. Stan notices this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a stupid accent too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, that is not appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Fuck French people. Fuck 'em in the ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mkay, you see, children. This is exactly what I'm talking about. We have to change the way you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you gonna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mackey crosses to a piano. He plays chords while spea the following lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are times when you get suckered in, by drugs and alcohol and sex with wom-en. But it's when you do these things too much (Singing) That you've got to clear your head and get back in touch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mackey plays the piano and sings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it, it's all up to you, mkay? With a method, there's nothing you can't do, mkay? You don't have to spend your life addicted to crack Homeless on the streets giving hand- jobs for cash as long as you follow this simple plan I'm fully convinced that it's, easy, mkay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are extremely disinterested. Mackey walks over t chalkboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step one: Think about fun. Think about all that you'll miss addicted to this Step two: Think it all through. Think how's this gonna change my life, what am I gonna miss? Step three: Go and hug a tree, Hug anything that gets in your way! And step four: Just don't do it anymore - it's easy, Mkay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackey gets the children in a circle all holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, kids! Sing along!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Extremely half-assed) You can do it, it's all up to you mkay? With a method, there's nothing you can't do, mkay? We don't have to spend our lives addicted to crack Homeless on the streets giving hand- jobs for cash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as you follow my simple plan I'm fully convinced that it's, easy, mkay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone starts dancing in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step one: Think about fun. Think about all that you'll miss addicted to this Step two: Think it all through. Think how's this gonna change my life, what am I gonna miss? Step three: Go and hug a tree, Hug anything that gets in your way! And step four: Just don't do it anymore - it's easy, Mkay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy, Mkay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone falls down laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's mom and the other moms watch the kids and Mr. Mack rolling around on the floor laughing on a security monito

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do they think this is?! Summer camp?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Kyle's mother walks in with a scowling look, interupting the kids and Mr. Mackey who are still laughin merrily. The other mothers are behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mackey, what is going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mackey stands up, looking scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we're just, starting our program...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is NOT a place for fun and games! This is rehabilitation! Now GET TO IT!! We at MAC have a trial to go to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mothers walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mkay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God Damn it your mom is a bitch, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news reporter stands in front of the Supreme Court. All around him are protestors, with signs that say CANADA NO! CAN'TADA! Still others hold signs with Kenny on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom I'm standing in front of the U.S. Supreme Court where the most important trial of the - day - is happening. Thousands of people have shown up from all over the country to show their outrage and disgust at Canada. Joining me now is Mrs. McKormick, mother of the poor little boy who was killed by the Canadians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny's mother steps into frame. She is wearing a shirt w Kenny's picture on it. Written on the T-shirt is 'Have yo seen my son? No, you haven't. He's dead.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. McKormick, you must really hate the Canadians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes I do, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever think you would see the day when thousands of people were wearing your son Kenny on T-shirts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I didn't. But if any of you would like one they're 14.95. Available in blue or white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporter thinks for a second, and then turns back to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can only imagine the intense, vehement trial that is going on inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip are on the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip... You knowingly, with malice of forethought were trying to destroy American culture, yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance rips a fart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES OR NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are all in the main room, sitting on a couch, huddled around a television. They laugh merrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! Mr. Mackey's gonna hear us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans are just showing their TRUE COLORS as smelly bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight the power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young boy that died lit himself on fire. It was unfortunate, but how can they blame US?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't believe the hype!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip laugh merrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all shout agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Adlib) Yeah! WooHoo!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO COURTHOUSE
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip laugh merrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot oppress us! We will continue to pursue our art. We know there are Americans out there who will help us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's mother now stands up from the prosecutor's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your 'ART' is shallow and immature! We Americans do NOT allow that for our children!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. You teach your children that America is the land of the free. But it's all bullshit. You're one of the most conservative countries in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children all listen, wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is you don't allow your children to think for themselves. You try to raise them in a protective bubble, and then when they finally get old enough, they realize they've been lied to, and they resent you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, God, no wonder your country is so fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT IS ENOUGH!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAKE UP AMERICA! YOUR government censors YOU from the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO THEY DON'T!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES THEY DO! AND I'LL PROVE IT TO YOU! IN MARCH OF LAST YEAR, THE AMERICAN GOVERNMENT-

dialogues.speaker: BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOP.
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the screen goes blank. A sign that says 'PLEASE STAND BY' comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all watch, wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station CONVENIENTLY went blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Canadian Prime Minister stands directly in front of camera, looking right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTENTION AMERICA!! You have taken our national treasure Terrance and Phillip. We, in turn, have taken yours... The Smothers Brothers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Canadian Prime Minister steps out of the way, reveali the Smothers Brothers tied up in chairs behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you catch your breath... Now, release Terrance and Phillip, or else we will EXECUTE your beloved Smothers Brothers!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please listen to them!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not fucking around!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not fucking around. This is not aboot deals. This aboot dignity. This is aboot freedom... This is aboot respect. RETURN Terrance and Phillip NOW!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Canadian leans in and whispers in the Prime Minister's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... AND FUCK YOU, AMERICA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his middle finger, but it's all blurred and digitized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay kids, for today's rehabilitation activity, we're going to watch the Terrance and Phillip movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, this is an EDITED version of the movie, which was put out by the MPAA. That's the Motion Picture Association of America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that censorship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No the MPAA is NOT a censorship group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Because they say so... Mkay. Now I want you to watch this movie, with all the immature profanity taken out, and notice how much better a movie it becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackey puts the tape in and hits play. The TITLES come up 'Terrance and Phillip Asses of Fire' Except that 'Asses' has been blurred out, and replaced wi 'bunz'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOORAY!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie begins. Phillip walks in. But it isn't Phillip' voice, somebody has dubbed him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Terrance. I feel like I'm going to pass gas near your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would rather you didn't, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip farts on Terrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you are such a maroon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would know, dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys look confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are pigeon-like in your intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pseudo-Terrance and Phillip laugh. Terrance throws a match on Phillip and Phillip burns to death. A TITLE comes up - THE END. And the credits roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, they cut out 92 minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the theater come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you see, the point and the theme of the film is kept intact. And of course, the MPAA didn't cut out any of the graphic violence. What did you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I'm gonna need a cherry pie to get the taste of ass out of my mouth from that piece of shit movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, you're not watching your mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get me Cheesy Poofs with the delightful cheddar crunch, and I'll watch my fucking mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric!!!!  You need to be rehabilitated. Help me to help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself prickfuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a prickfuck, mkay? You little asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackey slaps his hand over his mouth and looks around, sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, you stupid asshole prickfuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mackey is in a private office with the members of M.A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is the children's progress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very encouraging. Most of the children have been weened from their naughty mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean MOST, why not ALL?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Nervous) Well, some of the children just don't respond to 12 step programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll have to resort to plan B and call the v-chip organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dramatic MUSIC STING. Mackey looks afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brovlofski, the V-chip hasn't been fully tested yet, it could be dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Evil) I don't care if it's dangerous! Desperate times call for desperate measures, Mr. Mackey. Perhaps I need to remind you of your situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Nervous) Alright, I'll make the call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are again glued to the TV watching the trial of Terrance and Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the courthouse, the jury walks in and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam foreman, have you reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How find you, the jury?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We the jury, find the defendants... Terrance and Phillip... GUILTY of being complete bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd goes wild. The mothers of M.A.C. stand and chee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids sit in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh oh, Phillip. You know what this means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be farting bread and water for a few years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The judge bangs her gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip, for crimes against the great nation of America you are hereby sentenced to DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH?! You gotta be shittin' me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aghgh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids can't believe what they're seeing. Everyone is silent. Finally, Kyle perks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, let's help Terrance and Phillip!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that in Arizona or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Kyle walk into the middle of town, where a HUGE bonfire of Terrance and Phillip videos, posters, and Cana items like syrup and hockey sticks are burning away. The soldiers throw Stan's book on top of the pile, and it starts to burn. Stan and Kyle walk up to where Cartman is standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're burning all the Canadian stuff cause of the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That book wasn't Canadian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde, one of the kids from school, throws his Terrance a Phillip dolls into the burning mass. Kyle stops him on his way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, don't you like Terrance and Phillip anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not! We're at war! My daddy says I HATE Canadians now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More kids line up to burn their Terrance and Phillip stuf Several random mothers from M.A.C. are standing in front the bonfire with anti-Canadian signs and T-shirts. The bo parents aren't around, but another MAC mother is leading charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT'S IT! BURN EVERYTHING CANADIAN!!! MAKE OUR COUNTRY DECENT AGAIN FOR OUR CHILDREN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A townsperson throws Alanis Morisette albums into the fir Another townsperson runs up and throws in a bag of Cheesy Poofs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NNOOOO!!!! WHAT ARE YOU DOING?! OH, WHY GOD, WHY?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartman falls to his knees and cries as the Cheesy Poofs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all cause of your mom, Kyle. She's such a bitch- (BBBZAATT!!) AGH!! I mean - she's such a... meanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's getting worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude... Isn't that your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks to where a group of big, mean FIFTH GRADERS ha encircled Ike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go back to your own country, CANADIAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, go eat some potatoes and ride donkeys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eee todo ba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's eyes grow wide. He dashes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a smelly Canadian. They're like rats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look Canadian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's adopted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle picks his brother up and tries to protect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you better get his beady eyed Canadian ass out of America before my daddy finds him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys watch in horror as the fifth graders run over an throw more Canadian items into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a matter of time before my mom has HIM burned too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has the world come to? This is horrible. We're locked up, burning books, hating other people-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -no Cheesy Poofs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -No Cheesy Poofs... What the hell is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRAMATIC MUSIC begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But it has gone far enough! I'm sick of it! (Singing) Something must be done! Change has got to come around! They're taking all our laughter and burning it to the ground! Can't you see what this is leading to? A world of chains and ties and glue! We have to fight before they've taken every one! Something must be done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree! The only way to save our future is to unite and fight! (Singing) Something must be done! We must take action fast! My parents have gotten so strict they forgot they were children in the past!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my mom has become so bu-sy that she's raising heck and ignoring me I agree that there is now a battle to be won! Something must be done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are we going to do against this entire army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta get the word out. We'll get on my dad's computer and use the internet! Come on you guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys proudly head down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something must be done! Something's gotta give! This world has become a bitch in which we have no desire to live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (*note- cartman gets shocked again on 'bitch')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've pushed it to the edge And now the time has come! Something's gotta change! Something must be done! Something must be done!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is at the keyboard of his dad's computer. Stan and Cartman are waiting in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I just need to find a few private message boards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Before we put a message out, do a search on the word 'clitoris'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle types in the word and hits return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading the screen) "Found Eight Million Pages With the Word Clitoris"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just try the first one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle clicks the mouse. They wait for the screen to load. Finally, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! It's a lady giving a blow job to a horse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Cartman rush over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Cartman's mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... It IS Cartman's mom!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartman looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, son of a bitch! (ZZAP!!) AAGHGH!! I mean, son of a biscuit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe THAT'S who your father is, Cartman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ike bounces in, happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ber dada!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here Ike, you're too young for this stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa mama simi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ike bounces out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, just get to the message board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, I can't find a Canadian server... I've got to break into the main frame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle furiously hits a bunch of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! They've got an access code! I'll try to reroute the encryptions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle furiously hits a bunch more keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, do you know what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dude, all you have to do is hit the keys really fast and say a bunch of stupid shit and it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the screen pops up. Access Granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo. Okay, here we go... (Typing) Want to help Terrance and Phillip? Meet us for a meeting at Gladdy's barn tomorrow night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em we'll have pie and punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna have pie and punch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More people will come if they think there'll be pie and punch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Typing) pie and punch... This is Top Secret. The password is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys all think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Dramatically) La Resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triumphant MUSIC cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the attic pops open.  Kyle shoves Ike up into attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay up here in the attic, Ike. Don't make any noises or nothing, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Ike, we're all going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes and it is dark. Ike blinks. He looks out a small window, onto the street below. A few armed soldiers walk by. Ike pulls out a little plastic harmonica and sadly starts play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tons of MILITARY PERSONNEL are running to and fro. Giant computer screens show Canada's latest attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! The Canadians have destroyed Des Moines!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs merrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a PENTAGON GUY runs up to the President, holdin some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're tracking a signal crossing into Canadian computers! It looks like we may have a resistance movement starting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President grabs the papers and dashes over to Kyle's mother, who is standing there looking smug, with her arms behind her back and her chest out. She has a few military badges on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Showing her the papers) Ma'am, we're tracking a resistance... It's probably Canadian spies!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well find out where that signal is coming from!  Then hunt them down like dogs! Any and all Canadian influence must be stopped at all cost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President starts to run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm needing lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away, ma'am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so the draft will begin tomorrow, as more and more troops are needed to fight the Canadian forces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartman's mother is tucking him into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is quickly being referred to as 'The Great Canadian-American War' has already reached a death toll of two million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartman's mother reaches over and switches off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom... When is the war gonna be over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know honey. Soon we hope. You want it to end quickly, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't care, I was just asking cuz all my favorite TV shows have been replaced by news and it's pissing me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Cartman's mother gets up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you went down on a horse... You'd tell me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, hon. Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She switches off the light, and leaves. Cartman lies there, lit only by soft, blue moonlight and thinks. He hears a SCRAPING noise, and looks a little scared, but then tries to close his eyes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away, scary noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the SCRAPING. Cartman pops open hs eyes to see - KENNY! He is transparent and floating above Cartman's bed Cartman is horrified. Too much so to even scream. Kenny puts his hands to his mouth to try and speak, but h makes no sound. Finally, Cartman lets out a piercing cry. Cartman's mother comes running in, just as the image of K disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric?! Eric, what is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him!! I saw Kenny!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartman's mother looks around and sees nothing. Finally, just cradles Cartman's fat head in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you poor dear. You've been through so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet him he couldn't set himself on fire and now he's all pissed off!! (BZZTZT!) AGH! I can't say pissed off?! (BAZZTZT!!) AGH!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny is again snooping around. He quietly creaks Satan's door open and walks in. Satan is in his room, looking at a map of Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The execution of Terrance and Phillip is imminent, soon all hell shall rise!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Evil and scary) Are you afraid, little one? Afraid for the souls of your pitiful friends that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Saddam walks in carrying some bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Satan!  I got some great new home furnishings today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satan rolls his eyes and sighs. His attempt to be evil to Kenny is squashed again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy buddy Rich, it was a bitch to get something to match with that bathroom tile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saddam looks at Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey kid. Find those proofs of purchases yet? No?! Gee, whatta surprise! Well, keep lookin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Satan folds his arms and looks at the floor, piss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna know what I did today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saddam lets out a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do today Satan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey fella!  Relax!  This whole armageddon thing has got you all stressed out. Let's make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when you first got here? We used to talk all night long. Until the sun came up... We would just lie in bed and TALK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I wanted to fuck you, dumbass! Now hows aboot you get those pants down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me dumb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean cute dumb. Now bend over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As this conversation happens, Kenny's eyes dart back and forth as if watching a tennis match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you always want to make love to me from behind? Is it because you want to pretend I'm somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saddam sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satan, your ass is gigantic and red, who am I gonna pretend you are? Helen Reddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, kid. Help me with these shower curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saddam and Kenny walk out. Leaving Satan all alone with s music playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gently) Sometimes I think When I look up real high That there's a whole world up there And just maybe it could be mine But then, I sink because it's here I'm supposed to stay but I don't even know how or why its supposed to be that way-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satan walks to his veranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there, there is so much room Where babies burp and flowers bloom Everyone dreams I can dream too Up there, Up where The skies are ocean blue I could be safe and live without a care... Up there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satan walks over to a bright blue globe and spins it slow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say I don't belong That my place is down below Because of my beliefs I'm supposed to stay where evil is sewn But what is evil anyway? Is there reason to the rhyme? Without evil there could be no good So it must be good to be evil sometimes Up there, there is so much room Where babies burp and flowers bloom. Everyone dreams I can dream too Up there, Up where The skies are ocean blue I could be safe and life without a care... Up there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK, big crane shot rising above Satan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim light is all that is visible from inside the small building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Kyle are painting a sign on the wall 'La Resistance'. Cartman comes running in, he looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late, Cartman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to ride my bike here. My behind is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your behind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say 'behind'! I get shocked if I say 'ass- (BBZZAATT) OW!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the pie and punch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you guys... Something happened... You guys wanna hear something creepy? (Looking over each shoulder) I don't think Kenny is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Cartman, I know.  I see Kenny every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU DO?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, dude.  On the face of every child, on the smile of every baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Stan laugh again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  I'm telling you this WAS Kenny! I think he's haunting me.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK
dialogues.text: The boys all look scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys walk over to the door, and open the sliding pane front of their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh... I'm here for La Resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the password?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh... Bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle opens the door. The golden haired young boy from reh stands there looking handsome and angelic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viva la Resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, it's that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the place--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another kid walks up next to Gregory, it's Wendy. Stan's grow wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan?! YOU started La Resistance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, apparently you have a bigger heart than we thought. Let us get this meeting underway, there are others coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory takes Wendy's hand and pushes his way in. Stan fu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the room is filled with a bunch of scared looking RESISTANCE FOLLOWERS. All of whom are under the age of twelve. The room is lit only by candlelight. And the large 'VIVA RESISTANCE' banner hands on the wall. Stan and Kyle look nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone be seated, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, a lot of people showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so what do we say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had something planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan looks out over the faces. Gregory checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Nervous) Kay. Uh... Terrance and Phillip are supposed to be killed, and we think that sucks ass!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids don't respond. Stan shoots a nervous look at Wen who is sitting next to Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh... So we think we should prank call a bunch of policemen! We can have pizzas sent to them that they didn't order! VIVA LA RESISTANCE!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again no response. Gregory rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory takes Stan's place at the front of the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance and Phillip are currently being held at a Canadian Internment camp two kilometers outside of town. They are to be executed tomorrow during a star-studded USO show for the troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory pulls a big map out of nowhere and rolls it out. and Kyle can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must sneak into the camp through this duct, freeing Terrance and Phillip inside... The war is escalating, and the American forces are preparing for a large scale attack on Canada. That means the time is now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, dude, Wendy's new guy is smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan shoots Kyle a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a dangerous mission, so I'll go myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy smiles at Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE going! WE started La Resistance to save Terrance and Phillip! We're going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be very dangerous... Are you quite sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that! (BZZT) AGAGH!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going... Let's run through the plan!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge hall is filled with hundreds of soldiers in differ battalions. We see our regulars: Mr. Garrison with a uniformed Mr. Ha Mr. Mackey, Jimbo and Ned, Bo, Pip, Stan's Grandfather, Jesus, Officer Barbrady....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so glad there's a war again. I was gettin' worried I'd never see another one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're giving all us troops a big USO tomorrow with celebrities and executions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER to Mr. Garrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great in your new uniform Mr. Hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do too, Mr. Garrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I can't wait for our first shore- leave so I can go get me some poontang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef sits down in a seat behind Garrison near the back. GENERAL PLYMKIN, a gruff old army type with bug eyes, ste up to a podium and addresses the troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAY ATTENTION!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd settles down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no secret that the Evil Canadian Federation has scored major victories all over the United State.  We have brought you here because you ar America's best, and last hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another general leans over to Plymkin and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Apparently you're not the best, you're simply the last. Anyway, let's strategize... Map!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, holographic 3-D map of South Park springs up in front of him.  He walks around it pointing out things wit laser-pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our sources have told us that the Canadians might try to attach tomorrow's USO show and stop us from executing Terrance and Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a spot on the 3-D map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now each battalion has a specific code- name and mission.  Battalion 5, raise your hands-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef is in Battalion 5 and dutifully raises his hand. Then he looks around and notices to his surprise that everybody else in his section is also African American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be the all-important first defense wave, which we will call 'Operation Human Shield'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now keep in mind, 'Operation Human Shield' will suffer heavy losses.  But don't lose your spirit men!  Stay until the bitter end.  Battalion 14?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of white guys raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, you are 'Operation Get Behind The Darkies'.  You will follow Battalion 5 here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a spot on the 3-D map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and try not to get killed for God's Sake.  Are there any questions men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes soldier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of the Emancipation Proclamation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't listen to hip-hop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
